name: The Wild Oasis
summary: This project is a real-world like porject intimate the inside website for a booking system for cabins.
details: The Wild Oasis is an immersive project, showcasing a real-world-like booking system for holiday cabins. Built with cutting-edge technologies, including React for responsive frontend development, Supabase for seamless database management, and Styled Components for a stylish design. The project can be further developed by implementing booking management system

gifs.explanation: The user can view the details of each booking, and can also check in the booking.
The logged in user can create, duplicate, edit and delete cabins.
The user can view the details of each booking, and can also check in the booking.
The logged in user can create, duplicate, edit and delete cabins.

name: Solar Offset
summary: Solar Offset is a university project, with the aim of creating a platform allowing UK residents to contribute to solar panel installations in African countries, thereby offsetting household carbon emissions.
details: This university team project involved using technologies such as React and Ant-design for front-end development, Node.js for back-end processes, and MongoDB for database management. The project also involves API integration. The focus was on practical application, collaborative development, and problem-solving which gives me an understanding of the full-stack web development lifecycle.

gifs.explanation: The application allows registered and non-registered user to select and pay for the solar plan of their choices.
The registered user can log in can check their purchase history on the dashboard, and they can change their housetype for a rough estimation of the CO2 emmission of the household.
For a precise calculation of the CO2 emission of the household, the user can use the footprint calculator panel to seek the results.

name: Bird Sighting
summary: This project is for bird lovers to post their spottings of bird with and without WiFi. And they are also chat online to share their thoughts about this bird.
details: This project is designed for bird lovers to share their spottings of the bird they spotted. The user can post new birding sighings with and without Wi-fi. And all the sightings that have been viewed when the Wifi is availiable are saved in the IndexedDB for offline viewing.

gifs.explanation: For a precise calculation of the CO2 emission of the household, the user can use the footprint calculator panel to seek the results.
The users can chat in real-time, the chat history will be saved in the database.
The author of the post can edit the bird identification. This can be done by manually input new infomation, or by searching the knowledge graph as shown in the GIF.

The application can be accessed when offline, using service worker to save the HTML pages, and indexedDB to save the data. The sightings that are viewed online are saved into the idb, and therefore can be accessed when offline. Whne the user is back online, the data will be synced to the MongoDB and persist.

name: React Pizza.co
summary: This application allows users to easily browse and order pizzas online.
details: This project is for practicing, leveraging React Router for smooth navigation and integrating Redux with Thunks for efficient state management. Tailwind CSS was also explored for a modern web design. I also designed 'apiRestaurant' for fetching the data menu and order infomation.

gifs.explanation: The user can view and order the pizza. The express delivery can be selected when placing the order, or when viewing the summary of the order.

The user can search the order in the application. If the order exsits, the infomation of the customer and the order details will be shown. If the order does not exist, the not found page would display.

name: Heartbeat Classification
summary: This is my dissertation project aiming to automatically classify the heatbeat using 12-lead ECG (electrocardiogram) data.
details: This project uses deep learning method to automatically detect the differences laying within ECG recordings, and therefore classifying the heartbeat into 6 categories. The core objectives encompass data preparation, model construction and comprehensive performance evaluation.

gifs.explanation: The project is using a large-scale ECG database to classify normal heartbeat, and 5 different Cardiovascular diseases affected heartbeat.

The main steps involved are preprocessing the data, construsting and experimenting with the models, train the models and finally evaluate the models. The augementation was particularly important, since the original data was highly imbalanced.

The final models are two dimensional Convolutional neuron netword(CNN), and 1D residual Network. For each model I experimented with different depth and different shap of data to seek the best results.
The final best F1-score was 83% using augmentated data with the 1D-RestNet. The results were carefully tested and evlauated.
The final best F1-score was 83% using augmentated data with the 1D-RestNet. The results were carefully tested and evlauated.

This is a light weight project having both front-end and back-end service, focusing on practicing react router and useContext.
